com.ibasco.agql.protocols.valve.source.query.client

Class SourceQueryClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibasco.agql.core.AbstractClient<Req,Res,M>
      • com.ibasco.agql.core.client.AbstractGameServerClient<SourceServerRequest,SourceServerResponse,SourceQueryMessenger>
        • com.ibasco.agql.protocols.valve.source.query.client.SourceQueryClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client<SourceServerRequest,SourceServerResponse>, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class SourceQueryClient
extends AbstractGameServerClient<SourceServerRequest,SourceServerResponse,SourceQueryMessenger>
    A client used for querying information on Source servers. Based on the Valve Source Query Protocol.
    See Also:
    Valve Source Server Query Protocol

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getServerChallenge

        public CompletableFuture<Integer> getServerChallenge(SourceChallengeType type,
                                                     InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieves a Server Challenge number from the logger. This is used for some requests (such as PLAYERS and RULES) that requires a challenge number.

        Parameters:
        type - A SourceChallengeType
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture returning a value of Integer representing the logger challenge number

      • getServerChallengeFromCache

        public CompletableFuture<Integer> getServerChallengeFromCache(InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieves a challenge number from the internal cache if available. If the challenge number does not yet exist in the cache then a request (using: getServerChallenge(SourceChallengeType, InetSocketAddress)) will be issued to the logger to obtain the latest challenge number.

        This is considered to be thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture containing the resulting challenge Integer
        See Also:
        getServerChallenge(SourceChallengeType, InetSocketAddress)

      • getServerRules

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getServerRules(InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieve source logger rules information. Please note that this method sends an initial challenge request (Total of 5 bytes) to the logger using getServerChallenge(SourceChallengeType, InetSocketAddress). If you plan to use this method more than once for the same address, please consider using getServerRulesCached(InetSocketAddress) instead.

        Parameters:
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that contains a Map of logger rules

      • getServerRules

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getServerRules(int challenge,
                                                            InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieve source logger rules information. You NEED to obtain a valid challenge number from the logger first.

        Parameters:
        challenge - The challenge number to be used for the request
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that contains a Map of logger rules
        See Also:
        getServerChallenge(SourceChallengeType, InetSocketAddress), getServerChallengeFromCache(InetSocketAddress)

      • getServerRulesCached

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getServerRulesCached(InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieve source logger rules information. Uses the internal cache to retrieve the challenge number (if available).

        Parameters:
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that contains a Map of logger rules
        See Also:
        getServerChallengeFromCache(InetSocketAddress)

      • getPlayers

        public CompletableFuture<List<SourcePlayer>> getPlayers(InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieve a list of active players in the logger. Please note that this method sends an initial challenge request (Total of 5 bytes) to the logger using getServerChallenge(SourceChallengeType, InetSocketAddress). If you plan to use this method more than once for the same address, please consider using getPlayersCached(InetSocketAddress) instead.

        Parameters:
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that contains a List of SourcePlayer currently residing on the logger
        See Also:
        getPlayers(int, InetSocketAddress)

      • getPlayers

        public CompletableFuture<List<SourcePlayer>> getPlayers(int challenge,
                                                        InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieve a list of active players in the logger. You NEED to obtain a valid challenge number from the logger first.

        Parameters:
        challenge - The challenge number to be used for the request
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that contains a List of SourcePlayer currently residing on the logger
        See Also:
        getPlayers(InetSocketAddress), getServerChallenge(SourceChallengeType, InetSocketAddress), getServerChallengeFromCache(InetSocketAddress)

      • getPlayersCached

        public CompletableFuture<List<SourcePlayer>> getPlayersCached(InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieve a list of active players in the logger. This uses the internal cache to retrieve the challenge number (if available).

        Parameters:
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that contains a List of SourcePlayer currently residing on the logger
        See Also:
        getPlayers(int, InetSocketAddress), getServerChallengeFromCache(InetSocketAddress)

      • getServerInfo

        public CompletableFuture<SourceServer> getServerInfo(InetSocketAddress address)

        Retrieves information of the Source Server

        Parameters:
        address - The InetSocketAddress of the source logger
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that contains SourceServer instance

        public int getMaxCacheSize()
        Returns:
        The maxmimum size allowable for the internal challenge cache

      • setMaxCacheSize

        Sets the maximum allowable size for the internal challenge cache
        Parameters:
        maxCacheSize - An int representing the cache size

      • getCacheExpiration

        public long getCacheExpiration()
        Returns:
        Returns the duration (in minutes) used by the internal cache service to expire entries.

      • setCacheExpiration

        public void setCacheExpiration(Duration cacheExpiration)
        Parameters:
        cacheExpiration - A Duration instance representing the time it will take to expire cached entries

      • setCacheExpiration

        public void setCacheExpiration(long cacheExpiration)
        Parameters:
        cacheExpiration - A number representing the duration (in minutes) to expire cached entries

      • getCacheRefreshInterval

        public Duration getCacheRefreshInterval()
        Returns:
        A Duration representing the time it will take to refersh a challenge in the internal cache

      • setCacheRefreshInterval

        public void setCacheRefreshInterval(Duration cacheRefreshInterval)
        Sets the refresh interval of each cached entry
        Parameters:
        cacheRefreshInterval - The Duration representing the refresh interval for each cached entry
